work.name: University of Malta
work.summary: Postdoc on MQSENS, researching into quantum Zeno dynamics.

publications.name: Cooperative Effects in opto- and nanomechanics
publications.summary: This thesis presents works in optomechanics which describes the interaction of electromagnetic radiation with massive objects through radiation pressure.

publications.name: Floquet control of optomechanical bistability in multimode systems
publications.summary: Like in photonic lasers, phonon lasing normally occurs in a single mechanical mode. We show here that mode-locked, multimode phonon lasing can be established in a multimode optomechanical system through Floquet dynamics induced by a temporally modulated laser drive.

publications.name: Floquet phonon lasing in multimode optomechanical systems
publications.summary: Like in photonic lasers, phonon lasing normally occurs in a single mechanical mode. We show here that mode-locked, multimode phonon lasing can be established in a multimode optomechanical system through Floquet dynamics induced by a temporally modulated laser drive.

publications.name: Floquet dynamics in photonic crystal optomechanical nanoresonator
publications.publisher: The European Conference on Lasers and Electro-Optics
publications.summary: We explore the interaction between a mechanical resonator and a modulated thermo-optic cavity, using an integrated photonic crystal nanomembrane. These results open perspectives in the realization of logic gates using multimode optomechanical devices.

publications.name: Chimera states in small optomechanical arrays
publications.summary: We study the dynamics of optomechanical arrays—networks of mechanically compliant structures that interact with the radiation pressure force—which are driven to self-oscillation. We demonstrate that this system supports the existence of long-lived chimera states, where parts of the array synchronize while others do not.

publications.name: Prime number decomposition using the Talbot effect
publications.summary: We report on prime number decomposition by use of the Talbot effect, a well-known phenomenon in classical near field optics whose description is closely related to Gauss sums. The new algorithm is experimentally verified and the limits of the approach are discussed.

projects.name: Quantum Zeno Dynamics
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
